title: Rangers Football Club logo typeface
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924105247im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/10_4809.jpg)

Can anyone identify the font used for ’RANGERS’ in this photo?

Kind regards,  
foxtrot

 [‹ (x) Eis am Stiel "Summertime Blues" - Banco, hand lettering {Dan, Geoff, Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924105247/http:/www.typophile.com/node/20913 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Lula magazine headlines and nameplate - Kursivschrift {Yves} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924105247/http:/www.typophile.com/node/21061 "Go to next forum topic")
author: foxtrot_yankee

comments.content:
As with most professional sports teams, this is probably a custom font, but [Cachet Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924105247/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=C.103160.0.3&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=RANGERS&sampleSize=48) is close.

- Mike Yanega

It looks kind of like a cross between Handel Gothic and Stainless by Font Bureau. I tried a web search for Rangers related PDFs (to see if something like it might be embedded for a quick ID) but didn’t find much -at least not anything with that type in it.

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924105247im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/rfc_header1_4275.gif)

This is the only other image I could find at the moment.

Stainless looks pretty close apart from slight differences in the R, G and S.
